Description: Yellow flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Thrives in well-drained, rocky soil.

Name: Lupine (Lupinus spp.)
Description: Tall spikes of purple, blue, or pink flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Prefers well-drained soil and full sun.

Name: Lamb’s Lettuce (Valerianella locusta)
Description: Small, delicate flowers blooming in spring (April-May). Grows well in full sun with moderate watering.

Name: Wild Rose (Rosa spp.)
Description: Pink or red flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Prefers full sun and well-drained soil.

Name: Mountain Laurel (Kalmia latifolia)
Description: Clusters of pink or white flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Thrives in acidic, well-drained soil.

Name: Meadow Rue (Thalictrum spp.)
Description: Delicate flowers in shades of purple, pink, or white blooming in late spring (May-June). Prefers moist soil and partial shade.

Name: Wild Strawberries (Fragaria vesca)
Description: White flowers blooming in early spring (March-April), followed by edible red fruit. Grows well in full sun and requires moderate water.

Name: Poppy (Papaver spp.)
Description: Brightly colored flowers in red, orange, or yellow blooming in late spring to early summer (May-June). Prefers full sun and well-drained soil.

Name: Arctic Poppy (Papaver radicatum)
Description: Small, bright yellow flowers blooming in early spring (May). Thrives in cold, mountainous regions with well-drained soil.

Name: Siberian Squill (Scilla siberica)
Description: Bright blue flowers blooming in early spring (April-May). Prefers well-drained, moist soil in full sun or partial shade.

Name: Columbine (Aquilegia spp.)
Description: Delicate flowers in shades of purple, red, or blue blooming in late spring (May-June). Prefers well-drained, slightly acidic soil and partial shade.

Name: Siberian Larch (Larix sibirica)
Description: Small, cone-shaped flowers blooming in early spring (April). This tree prefers cold climates and well-drained soil.

Name: Creeping Juniper (Juniperus horizontalis)
Description: Greenish-blue berries and tiny flowers blooming in early spring (April-May). Grows in full sun with moderate watering.

Name: Yellow Rattle (Rhinanthus minor)
Description: Small yellow flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Grows well in dry, poor soil in full sun.

Name: Rhododendron (Rhododendron spp.)
Description: Large clusters of pink, white, or purple flowers blooming in spring (May). Prefers acidic, moist, well-drained soil.

Name: Russian Olive (Elaeagnus angustifolia)
Description: Small yellow flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.

Name: Alpine Buttercup (Ranunculus alpestris)
Description: Yellow flowers blooming in early spring (May). Prefers rocky, well-drained soil in sunny areas.

Name: Creeping Barberry (Berberis canadensis)
Description: Yellow flowers blooming in early spring (April-May). Grows in full sun with moderate watering.

Name: Snowdrop Anemone (Anemone sylvestris)
Description: White flowers blooming in early spring (April-May). Prefers moist, well-drained soil and full sun.

Name: Tamarisk (Tamarix spp.)
Description: Pink or white flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Prefers full sun and well-drained soil.

Name: Siberian Meadowsweet (Filipendula ulmaria)
Description: White or pink flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Thrives in moist, well-drained soil.

Name: Siberian Bluebell (Campanula sibirica)
Description: Blue flowers blooming in early spring (April-May). Prefers shaded, moist soil.

Name: Wormwood (Artemisia absinthium)
Description: Small, yellowish flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Thrives in dry, well-drained soil in full sun.

Name: Dogwood (Cornus spp.)
Description: White, pink, or red flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial shade.

Name: Red Clover (Trifolium pratense)
Description: Pink or purple flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Prefers full sun and moderate watering.

Name: Sweet Woodruff (Galium odoratum)
Description: White flowers blooming in spring (April-May). Thrives in shady, moist soil.

Name: Common Grape Hyacinth (Muscari armeniacum)
Description: Blue, bell-shaped flowers blooming in early spring (April-May). Prefers full sun or partial shade and well-drained soil.

Name: Russian Sagebrush (Artemisia dracunculus)
Description: Aromatic green foliage with tiny yellow flowers blooming in late spring (May). Prefers dry, well-drained soil and full sun.

Name: Spring Snowflake (Leucojum vernum)
Description: White flowers with green tips blooming in early spring (March-April). Thrives in moist, shaded areas.

Name: Periwinkle (Vinca minor)
Description: Purple or blue flowers blooming in early spring (March-April). Prefers partial shade and moist, well-drained soil.

Name: European Elderberry (Sambucus nigra)
Description: White flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Thrives in moist, well-drained soil.

Name: Red-twig Dogwood (Cornus sericea)
Description: White or cream flowers blooming in late spring (May). Prefers moist, well-drained soil in partial sun.

Name: Mountain Avens (Dryas octopetala)
Description: White or yellow flowers blooming in early spring (April-May). Prefers dry, well-drained soil in full sun.

Name: Juniper (Juniperus spp.)
Description: Small, blue or purple berries and inconspicuous flowers blooming in early spring (March-April). Grows in dry, well-drained soil.

Name: Golden Fleece (Thymus pulegioides)
Description: Tiny yellow flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.

Name: Scabiosa (Scabiosa spp.)
Description: Lavender or purple flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Prefers well-drained soil and full sun.

Name: Lesser Periwinkle (Vinca minor)
Description: Purple-blue flowers blooming in early spring (March-April). Prefers shaded areas with moist soil.

Name: False Indigo (Baptisia australis)
Description: Blue flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Prefers well-drained soil and full sun.

Name: Silverberry (Elaeagnus commutata)
Description: Small yellow or silver flowers blooming in late spring (May). Prefers dry, well-drained soil in full sun.

Name: Buttercup (Ranunculus acris)
Description: Bright yellow flowers blooming in spring (April-May). Thrives in moist, well-drained soil.

Name: Common Thistle (Cirsium vulgare)
Description: Purple flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Grows well in dry, disturbed soils in full sun.

Name: Spiraea (Spiraea spp.)
Description: Small white or pink flowers blooming in late spring (May). Prefers full sun and well-drained soil.

Name: Giant Fennel (Ferula communis)
Description: Yellowish flowers blooming in late spring (May). Thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.

Name: Yellow Balsam (Impatiens nolitangere)
Description: Yellow flowers blooming in early spring (March-April). Prefers partial shade and moist soil.

Name: Red-berried Elder (Sambucus racemosa)
Description: Small white flowers blooming in late spring (May). Thrives in moist, well-drained soil.

Name: Cow Parsnip (Heracleum maximum)
Description: Large white flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Prefers moist, well-drained soil.

Name: Common Yarrow (Achillea millefolium)
Description: White or yellow flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Prefers dry, well-drained soil in full sun.

Name: Creeping Charlie (Glechoma hederacea)
Description: Purple flowers blooming in late spring (May-June). Thrives in shady, moist areas.
